title: Eddie Hearn reveals Anthony Joshua is sparring 'chubby' fighters to replicate Andy Ruiz Jnr
text:
Eddie Hearn has revealed Anthony Joshua is sparring 'chubby fighters' in a bid to prepare himself best for Andy Ruiz Jnr - the only man to have beaten him in a professional ring.

Joshua is in the midst of his 12-week training camp and is working towards avenging his shock defeat in the money-spinning December 7 rematch with Ruiz Jnr in Saudi Arabia.

The Brit came under criticism for not preparing accordingly for Ruiz, a shorter and plumper heavyweight than what he's previously faced, following the upset in New York earlier this year, but Hearn has insisted his approach this time is much more specific to the Mexican's style.

Anthony Joshua is sparring 'chubby' fighters in camp to replicate Andy Ruiz Jnr's style

'It's madness. There's eight weeks to go, and he's been in camp for four weeks already,' Hearn told Fino Boxing.

'A lot of early sparring now is replicating the style of Ruiz.

'Last time we had probably three weeks of sparring, and it was tough to find a guy like Ruiz, because there aren't many like him.

'Small, a little bit chubby, fast hands, and really good on the inside. Now we've replicated that, I feel like the preparation is going to be great.'

Eddie Hearn believes they've had the right sparring and is confident preparations will be great

Ruiz, however, has fired a warning to Joshua that he will be 'lighter, faster and more powerful' for the rematch.

The unified world champion vowed to whip himself in shape for his first defence of the WBA, WBO and IBF world titles and has shown off his new, leaner physique on social media this week.

Despite dropping Joshua four times on route to a seventh-round stoppage last time around, Ruiz is still considered the underdog for this fight.

But the Mexican is confident of shocking the world again on December 7.

'They will believe that in December they will win,' he said. 'People will always talk like this, but I have faith that we're going to win and shut up more mouths.'
